definition: prepared against war/to prepare for war/warmongering
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: The national squad are holding training camp in Beijing to prepare for the Asian Championship.
sentences.chinese: 国家队为了备战亚锦赛，在北京举行训练营。

sentences.english: After the 9th national games, the Chinese gymnastics team will prepare for the Athen Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 九运会后，中国体操队将进入雅典奥运会备战期。

sentences.english: The Chinese players are busy getting ready for the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 我国体育健儿正忙于备战2008年北京奥运会。

sentences.english: Be prepared against war, be prepared against natural disasters, and do everything for the people.
People believed in him and hence preparing war against US aggression.
sentences.chinese: 大家都信他，并为抵抗美国入侵而备战。

sentences.english: I will be concentrating on preparing for the NBA season and next year's Olympics," Yao said in comments published on Chinanews.com on Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 我要集中精力备战NBA新赛季和明年的奥运会。

sentences.english: It is an initiative to have standby forces in each of the regional economic groupings in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这项计画由非洲区域经济团体提供了备战的军力。

sentences.english: The drummer beat the soldiers to arms.
I will only be able to know something about him when we meet during pre-season.
sentences.chinese: 我只有在季前备战的时候见到他才会知道些什么。

sentences.english: If they have just eaten and not yet established their encampment, they can be attacked.
sentences.chinese: 刚用完餐，尚未整顿进入备战状态，可以攻击。

sentences.english: The government is ready to change its defensive posture to one prepared for military action.
sentences.chinese: 政府随时准备由防御状态转向备战状态。

sentences.english: It has been a perfect pre-season to start the championship.
sentences.chinese: 这是新赛季开始是一次完美的季前备战。

sentences.english: We started out with a penalization of 8 points, we had a different preparation.
sentences.chinese: 我们被罚8分，备战工作也进行得很艰难。

sentences.english: However, given the preparation time is too short, everyone still take compromise.
sentences.chinese: 不过，鉴于备战时间过短，大家还是采取折中的方法。

sentences.english: A substratum of war stirred within her.
sentences.chinese: 一种备战的意图在她的心里起伏。

sentences.english: I used it to maintain muscle mass while training for the San Diego Marathon.
sentences.chinese: 我在备战圣地亚哥马拉松赛时用它来锻炼肌肉力量。

definition: to train together/to practice as a group
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
competition schedule/the course of a race
